isb:docsection.name: Instructions
isb:docsection.label: instructions
isb:docsection.p: The &appName; library is available for download in two different compressed archive formats, Zip and "gzipped tar". The former is most commonly preferred by Windows users, and the latter is most commonly preferred by Unix users. There are two hyperlinks below, one for each of the archive formats. In most web browsers, you may download the archive by right-clicking with your mouse button and selecting "save link target as" from the menu that appears. Alternatively, you may click on the link, and be prompted with a "save as" dialog box. In either case, save the archive to your hard drive, and follow the instructions supplied below in the section appropriate to the archive type you seleted, to unpack the archive on your computer.

isb:docsection.name: Download
isb:docsection.label: download
isb:docsection.p:
Here are the links to the &appName; software:
&appName;.zip [Zip archive]
&appName;.tar.gz [Gzipped Tar archive]
Please remember to read the ReadMe document that can be found the "docs" subdirectory when you have unpacked the archive. For more information about how to use the &appName; software, please refer to the &appName; User Manual.
If you have any difficulties downloading or installing this software, please contact the developers at the e-mail address shown below.

isb:docsection.name: Zip Archive
isb:docsection.label: zipinst
isb:docsection.p:
To unpack the Zip archive, you would open a shell (or command) session and type at the prompt:
unzip &appName;.zip
You should see a list of the files that are unpacked. A subdirectory "&appName;" should be created, and all of the files should be placed within subdirectories of this directory.

isb:docsection.name: Gzipped Tar Archive
isb:docsection.label: tgzinst
isb:docsection.p:
To unpack the Gzipped Tar archive, you would open a shell (or command) session and type at the prompt:
tar xvzf &appName;.tar.gz
You should see a list of the files that are unpacked. A subdirectory "&appName;" should be created, and all of the files should be placed within subdirectories of this directory.
